it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.controller

Class UserGreeter

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.controller.UserGreeter

  • public class UserGreeter
extends java.lang.Object
    The user greeter is an object that takes various user modules that accept new users based on different criterias. For example, the user greeter will listen from new users coming from different sources (i.e.: ServerSocket or RMI). This class deals with sincronization, allocation and deallocation of the modules, and the wait for new users.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserGreeter()
      Create a new, empty user greeter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User accept()
      Waits for a client, listening for a user that may connect through any of the added modules.
      void addUserModule(IncomingUserModule module)
      Adds the given module to the modules that have to be used to retrieve incoming users.
      void close()
      Closes all the associated modules by killing the threads and then calls, for each module, IncomingUserModule.close() on the current thread.
      void init()
      Initializes all the modules by calling IncomingUserModule.init() on all the added modules.
      void start()
      Starts all the modules.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserGreeter

        public UserGreeter()
        Create a new, empty user greeter.

    • Method Detail

      • addUserModule

        public void addUserModule(IncomingUserModule module)
                   throws InvalidStateException
        Adds the given module to the modules that have to be used to retrieve incoming users.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given module is null.
        InvalidStateException - if this method is called after the init() method. This is to avoid adding new modules while the already added modules are running.

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes all the modules by calling IncomingUserModule.init() on all the added modules.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws InvalidStateException
        Starts all the modules. A new thread for each added module is initialized and run, and it will continuously ask the associated module for new users by calling IncomingUserModule.newUser().
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException - if init() was not called on the same instance before this method.

      • accept

        public User accept()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for a client, listening for a user that may connect through any of the added modules. The method will return when a user has successfully established the connection according to the criteria defined by the corresponding module.
        Returns:
        A User object representing the newly connected client.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread receives an interrupt while waiting.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes all the associated modules by killing the threads and then calls, for each module, IncomingUserModule.close() on the current thread.
